name: Jose Lugo-Martinez
content: Jose Lugo-Martinez Home Research Publications CV Software Jose Lugo-Martinez Assistant Professor Computational Biology Department School of Computer Science Carnegie Mellon University 5000 Forbes Ave Pittsburgh PA 15213, USA Office: GHC 7411 Email: jlugomar [at] cs [dot] cmu [dot] edu Saludos! I am an Assistant Professor at the Ray and Stephanie Lane Computational Biology Department in the School of Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University (CMU). Prior to that, I was a Lane Fellow under the guidance of Professors Ziv Bar-Joseph and Robert F. Murphy. I received my doctoral degree in Computer Science at Indiana University, under the supervision of Professor Predrag Radivojac. My research group develops the next generation of computational approaches to accelerate biomedical knowledge discovery through automated and autonomous science. Download my curriculum vitae in pdf format (last updated on 11/29/2023). Latest News (October 2020) Our MutPred2 paper has been officially accepted in Nature Communications. (August 2020) Our paper about learning on hypergraphs using hypergraphlets has been accepted in Bioinformatics. (June 2020) Our ACM-BCB paper has been invited for an extended version to IEEE/ACM TCBB Special Issue. Education Ph.D. in Computer Science (Bioinformatics minor) Department of Computer Science Indiana University Advisor: Prof. Predrag Radivojac Dissertation Committee: Esfandiar Haghverdi, Matthew W. Hahn, Haixu Tang and Yuzhen Ye M.S. in Computer Science Department of Computer Science and Engineering University of California-San Diego Dual B.S. in Computer Science and Mathematics Department of Mathematics and Computer Science University of Puerto Rico-Rio Piedras Github Google Scholar Twitter Site maintained by Jose Lugo-Martinez | Last updated on 10/23/2020
